page.title: 16Old Industries
page.content: The old industries (or industries that have ceased production) in {Linwood}are mainly confined to the Car Plant.The plant was opened in 1964 as part of the{MacMillan Government's {Regional Development Policy}. The car plant was owned by the Coventry firm of{Rootes}. In 1971 Rootes was taken over by the American company{Chrysler. However the massive increase in the price of petrol in 1973 - 200% in three months - along with outdated models, caused the company great difficulties. The plant was sold in the late 1970s to the French consortium of{Peugeot/Talbot/Citroen. This, however , failed to solve the factory's problems and in 1982 it shut down with a loss of 3000 jobs. On the brighter side ,the{Linwood Paper Mill has continued production.{Galbrath {Stores}has started in the town.
